newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's Peters says NZ deserves AAA credit rating.
newsitem.headline: NZ's Peters says NZ deserves AAA credit rating.

text.p: New Zealand Treasurer Winston Peters said on Wednesday the country deserved an AAA rating from credit ratings agency Standard and Poor's.
Speaking to Reuters Financial Television in Sydney and monitored in Wellington, Peters said S&P could be more sympathetic in its approach to New Zealand.
"I think we are not being treated as sympathetically as we should be on this score," he said.
New Zealand currently has an AA-plus sovereign rating.
S&P is visiting New Zealand later this week as part of a regular review of credit conditions, but it says New Zealand's outlook is stable and it has indicated no plans to upgrade it.
Asked if S&P was being unfair, Peters replied that it could be more fair.
He said New Zealand was one of only nine countries that could claim an unbroken line of democracy for the last 130 years, "so we are very, very politically stable".
New Zealand had handled a new form of elections with "the greatest of ease", as a mixed member proportional voting system took the place of the British-style system in October last year.

"Alongside that we've had significant, dramatic debt repayment, we've had also a significant decline in the proportion of government expenditure to GDP. These are all fundamentally sound indicators," Peters said.
